reviewText: cannot say enough about how wonderful these programs are.  we have loved every single one of them and wish we could find more.  The quality is excellent, the content superb and the learning experienced amazing! My daughter loves it and I am thrilled that about how much she has learned from them.I am grateful to all who have worked so hard to produce such great quality of videos for our kids.  Thank you all! Many blessings to you.

Title: N/A

reviewText: My boys love Wild Kratts, unfortunately it is not on enough for them.  I actually had to mark it down on the calendar when the new "Lost At Sea" premier was because my boys kept asking when it was!  We of course watched it live and then they wanted to watch it again!The DVD features two episodes - Speaking Dolphinese and Blowfish Blowout - that feature sea life animals, hence the title "Lost at Sea." My boys love having a DVD of their favorite show and seriously have watched this DVD pretty much every day.  If your child has never seen the Wild Kratts show on PBS, it is a show that features two brothers in real life who show off real animals and then get animated for the show.  My boys think its neat to see both real life animals and then of course love the cartoon portion.  The show is wholesome, educational and honestly I don't mind watching it with them.  The guys take on the lives of animals to use their animal skills and tackle adventures.  Very cute and must for any child, animal lover or not!I received this DVD to review in exchange for my honest opinion.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Young animal lovers will be thrilled with the latest Kratt brothers show that premiered in January on PBS. Like Zoboomafoo before it, Wild Kratts(tm) is a blend of real life characters and animation meant to share fun animals facts with young viewers. We received a DVD of Lost At Sea which includes the episodes "Speaking Dolphinese" and "Blowfish Blowout."Chris and Martin Kratt have been teaching kids about creatures for decades. Their blend of animal facts and adventure make learning fun. Wild Kratts is a perfect addition to the PBS Kids line. It's also nice to see how they use technology to learn about their animal friends. This is something young people will truly relate to.I received a free DVD from PBS. This review contains my honest opinions, for which I have not been compensated in any way.
summary: More Zany Kratt Brothers Animal Loving Fun

reviewText: Sea life was always one of the most interesting units to share with young  children when I was teaching.  There is so much to learn about these wild life sea creatures.  When I saw the opportunity to review Wild Kratts Lost at Sea, I was so excited!My 4 year old grandson is studying sea life in his preschool this month.  While the video was entertaining, it was also full of information.  We have watched it three times this week when he visits.  "Blowfish Blowout" is his favorite, although we watch both episodes each time.I must admit that I learned many things about these sea creatures around the world that I never knew.  My 2 year old grandson has sat by my side watching Wild Kratts Lost at Sea with us too.  He is amused with the "wildly fun adventure" as much as the 4 year old.  I love the science lessons he is learning at such a young age.Videos that can educate and entertain are not easy to find these days.  I am so excited to add Wild Kratts Lost at Sea to my video library at my house.  I wish I would have had this video when I was teaching, I will share it with my grandsons preschool this week!
Title: N/A
